newsitem.title: BULGARIA: Bulgaria's UDF wins 58 pct - partial poll returns.
newsitem.headline: Bulgaria's UDF wins 58 pct - partial poll returns.

text.p: Partial official returns showed the reformist Union of Democratic Forces gaining 57.70 of votes in parliamentary elections, a spokeswoman for Bulgaria's central electoral commission said on Sunday.

The former ruling Socialists had 19.13 percent. The commission stressed the preliminary figures were based on only 18.75 percent of returns from polling stations, but they were in line with exit polls announced earlier.
The figures would give the UDF, which led a winter of unrest against the ex-communist Socialist government to demand elections two years ahead of schedule, an absolute majority in parliament.
Three smaller parties surpassed the four percent threshold required to win seats in the 240-seat parliament under the country's voting system.

Euroleft, made up largely of defectors from the Socialists, won 5.98 percent of votes, the Bulgarian Business Bloc 5.33, and the Union for National Salvation 5.00 percent, according to the partial returns.
Turnout was 56.41 of the electorate covered by the partial returns, the electoral commission said.
